snippet: Tailback Silas Redd, who ran for 1,241 yards last season, said Tuesday he was leaving Penn State for Southern California. Last weekend Redd visited U.S.C., which is expected to be highly ranked and contend for the Pacific-12 title.
abstract: Penn State tailback Silas Redd says he is transferring to Southern California; other college football news noted.
lead_paragraph: Tailback Silas Redd, who ran for 1,241 yards last season, said Tuesday he was leaving Penn State for Southern California. Last weekend Redd visited U.S.C., which is expected to be highly ranked and contend for the Pacific-12 title.

headline.main: Redd Leaves Penn State for U.S.C.
headline.print_headline: Redd Leaves Penn State for U.S.C.
